revised_title: Researches in Terrestrial Physics: Part II - The Pressures of the Shell and Nucleus at Their Surface of Contact
tldr: The author investigates the pressures at the surface of contact between the earth's shell and nucleus, considering factors such as molecular forces, the earth's rotation, and the effects of exterior forces on the shell and nucleus. The study aims to understand the changes that may have occurred within and at the surface of the earth during its geological history.
